des:
Once you know the name or group of your lights, you can say the following:
On/Off, Lights
 “Alexa, turn on bedroom light”
 “Alexa, turn off bedroom light”

Percentage, Dimmers
 “Alexa, set hallway light to 10 percent”
 “Alexa, brighten hallway light”
 “Alexa, dim family room”
 “Alexa, dim kitchen by 60 percent”
 “Alexa, brighten kitchen light by 80 percent”

Set Color
“Alexa, set the bedroom light to red”
“Alexa, change the kitchen to the color blue”


Make sure you have signed into your Bonfire Light account and have enabled your smart lights for remote control. Then follow these steps:
1. Enable this skill and link your Bonfire Light account. Make sure you have enabled Remote Access on your smart lights in the app.
2. Next, discover you smart lights by saying "Alexa, Discover Devices" or by clicking the Discover Devices button in the Smart Home section of the Alexa app.
3. Your smart lights should appear in your list of discovered devices using the name given in the Bonfire Light app.
4. Now all setup is finished, you can simply ask Alexa to turn on, turn off or dimming the light.
